snippet: Shareholders voting at last week’s annual meeting registered a spike in dissatisfaction with Wal-Mart Stores compared to last year, according to the company’s vote tally.
abstract: Wal-Mart Stores shareholders voting at the annual meeting register a spike in dissatisfaction with the company compared to 2011, according to the company’s vote tally; 'no' votes cast in the re-election of four board members exceeds 12 percent, the largest opposition any of them has encountered in an annual shareholder vote.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders voting at last week’s annual meeting registered a spike in dissatisfaction with Wal-Mart Stores compared to last year, according to the company’s vote tally.

headline.seo: Wal-Mart Vote Reflects Rise in Shareholder Unhappiness
headline.main: Wal-Mart Vote Shows Rise in Shareholder Unrest
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Vote Shows Rise in Shareholder Unrest
